member.name: T:TileEngine.TileLayer
member.summary: Describes a layer of tile textures for rendering

member.name: M:TileEngine.TileLayer.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an empty Tile Layer with specified dimensions

member.name: M:TileEngine.TileLayer.#ctor(System.Int32[0:,0:])
member.summary: Creates a Tile Layer with an existing layout
member.param: Integer texture index array of existing layout

member.name: M:TileEngine.TileLayer.fromFile(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.ContentManager,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a Tile Layer from file using the XNA Content Pipeline
member.param: Path (relative or absolute) to the .layer file
member.returns: New Tile Layer

member.name: M:TileEngine.TileLayer.fromFile(System.String,System.String[]@)
member.summary: Creates a Tile Layer from file without using the XNA Content Pipeline [used by Tile Editor]
member.param: Path (relative or absolute) to the .layer file
Output of string texture names referenced by the layer
member.returns: New Tile Layer
member.remarks: Textures must be added after initialization to the layer before calling draw()

member.name: M:TileEngine.TileLayer.processLayerFile(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Performs the IO on a .layer file to obtain a saved Tile Layer used by both fromFile() methods
member.param: Path (relative or absolute) to the .layer file
List of string texture names referenced by the layer
member.returns: New Tile Layer

member.name: M:TileEngine.TileLayer.save(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Saves a Tile Layer to file [used by Tile Editor]
member.param: Path (relative or absolute) where the .layer file should be saved
String array of texture names (relative to a content root) used by the layer

member.name: M:TileEngine.TileLayer.loadTileTextures(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.ContentManager,System.String[])
member.summary: Loads tile textures from file using the XNA Content Pipeline
member.param: String array of relative paths to texture asset names

member.name: M:TileEngine.TileLayer.addTexture(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Texture2D)
member.summary: Add a tile texture to the layer

member.name: M:TileEngine.TileLayer.removeTexture(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Texture2D)
member.summary: Remove texture from layer [used by Tile Editor]

member.name: M:TileEngine.TileLayer.textureIndex(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Texture2D)
member.summary: Get the index of a texture in tileTextures
member.returns: 0-Based index of texture if it exists in the layer; else -1.

member.name: M:TileEngine.TileLayer.setTileTexureIndex(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set a particular tile's texture index
member.param: 0-Based texture index; else, -1 for an empty tile

member.name: M:TileEngine.TileLayer.getTileTextureIndex(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the index of a texture at a particular tile
member.returns: 0-Based texture index; else, -1 for an empty tile or -2 if x/y out of range

member.name: M:TileEngine.TileLayer.getTileTextureIndex(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Point)
member.summary: Get the index of a texture at a particular tile
member.returns: Index of the texture located at the tile

member.name: M:TileEngine.TileLayer.replaceTextureIndex(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Replace all instances of on tile texture with another on the layer

0-Based texture index or -1 for empty tile

member.name: M:TileEngine.TileLayer.removeTextureIndex(System.Int32)
member.summary: Remove all reference to an index and shift all higher indexes down 1
member.remarks: Should only be used by removeTexture()

member.summary: Draws the Tile Layer

Camera used to view the layer

member.name: T:TileEngine.FrameAnimation
member.summary: Describes the frame animation used by a sprite. This object does not contain the textures, just the rectangles used to pull frames out of them.
member.remarks: With this current model, frames must be located on the same line horizontally in the texture to render.

member.name: M:TileEngine.FrameAnimation.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new Frame Animation
member.param: Number of frames in the animation
Width in pixels of the frame rectangle
Height in pixels of the frame rectangle
Offset in pixels in the x-direction of the first frame from the top-left corner of the texture
Offset in pixels in the y-direction of the first frame from the top-left corner of the texture

member.name: M:TileEngine.FrameAnimation.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new FrameAnimation [used only by the Clone() method]

member.name: M:TileEngine.FrameAnimation.Clone
member.summary: Clones the FrameAnimation
member.returns: Copy of the FrameAnimation
member.remarks: Frames are not cloned to conserve memory

member.name: M:TileEngine.FrameAnimation.update(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GameTime)
member.summary: Updates the current frame based on elapsed game time since the last update
member.param: GameTime passed from the game where the animation is rendered

member.summary: Gets or sets the frames per second of the animation

member.name: P:TileEngine.FrameAnimation.currentFrame
member.summary: Gets the current frame rectangle in the animation

member.summary: Get or set the current frame index of the animation

member.name: T:TileEngine.PriorityQueue
member.summary: Represents the priority queue data structure.

member.name: M:TileEngine.PriorityQueue.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the PriorityQueue class.
member.remarks: The PriorityQueue will cast its elements to the IComparable interface when making comparisons.

member.name: M:TileEngine.PriorityQueue.#ctor(System.Collections.IComparer)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the PriorityQueue class with the specified IComparer.
member.param: The IComparer to use for comparing and ordering elements.
member.remarks: If the specified IComparer is null, the PriorityQueue will cast its elements to the IComparable interface when making comparisons.

member.name: M:TileEngine.PriorityQueue.Enqueue(System.Object)
member.summary: Enqueues the specified element into the PriorityQueue.
member.param: The element to enqueue into the PriorityQueue.

member.name: M:TileEngine.PriorityQueue.Dequeue
member.summary: Removes the element at the head of the PriorityQueue.
member.returns: The element at the head of the PriorityQueue.

member.name: M:TileEngine.PriorityQueue.Remove(System.Object)
member.summary: Removes the specified element from the PriorityQueue.

member.name: M:TileEngine.PriorityQueue.Contains(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether the specified element is in the PriorityQueue.
member.returns: true if the element is in the PriorityQueue; otherwise false.

member.name: M:TileEngine.PriorityQueue.Peek
member.summary: Returns the element at the head of the PriorityQueue without removing it.
member.returns: The element at the head of the PriorityQueue.

member.name: M:TileEngine.PriorityQueue.Clear
member.summary: Removes all elements from the PriorityQueue.

member.name: M:TileEngine.PriorityQueue.Synchronized(TileEngine.PriorityQueue)
member.summary: Returns a synchronized wrapper of the specified PriorityQueue.
member.returns: A synchronized PriorityQueue.

member.name: M:TileEngine.TileMap.getPath(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Point,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Point,System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Point})
member.summary: Gets the A* Optimal path between two tile points on the map.
member.param: Other collisions (i.e., enemy sprites or objects) not on collision layer
member.returns: Stack of tile points to travel through to reach goal

member.name: M:TileEngine.TileMap.getPath(TileEngine.BaseUnit,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Point,System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Point})
member.summary: Gets the A* Optimal path between two tile points on the map for a particular unit.
member.param: The unit we are checking against.
Other collisions (i.e., enemy sprites or objects) not on collision layer
member.returns: Stack of tile points to travel through to reach goal

member.name: M:TileEngine.TileMap.walkToPoints(TileEngine.BaseUnit)
member.summary: Get the points within walking range of a unit
member.param: The unit currently attempting to walk
member.returns: A list of points within walking range

member.name: M:TileEngine.TileMap.comparePathHeuristic(System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair{Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Point,System.Int32[]},System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair{Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Point,System.Int32[]})
member.summary: Comparison function used by the getPath() method

member.name: M:TileEngine.TileMap.getNeighbors(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Point)
member.summary: Gets the neighbors of a point on the map
member.param: Point from which to find neighbors
member.returns: KeyValuePair of neighboring points and thier relative direction to the source Point
member.remarks: Collisions are not detected in this method. Used exclusively by the getPath() method.

member.name: M:TileEngine.TileMap.getDistance(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Point,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Point)
member.summary: Gets the discrete tile-based distance between points on the map
member.returns: Tile distance between points

member.name: M:TileEngine.TileMap.canPass(TileEngine.BaseUnit,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Point)
member.summary: Specifies whether a unit can pass through a given tile on the map. Units may pass over allies

member.param: The AnimatedSprite the camera should follow
member.remarks: When focused, the Camera cannot be controlled by the keyboard.

member.name: M:TileEngine.Camera.unsetFocus
member.summary: Unsets the focus of the camera
member.remarks: The camera will reobtain keyboard functionality

member.name: M:TileEngine.Camera.update(System.Int32,System.Int32,TileEngine.TileMap)
member.summary: Updates the camera location with respect to its focus, the viewport, and the current TileMap
member.param: Integer width in pixels of the viewport
Integer height in pixels of the viewport
The TileMap currently being rendered in the viewport

member.name: M:TileEngine.Camera.clampToArea(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Clamps the camera to only move within a specific area
member.param: Width in pixels of the area the camera can move
Height in pixels of the area the camera can move

member.name: P:TileEngine.Camera.speed
member.summary: Get or set the speed (pixels per update) of the camera motion

member.name: P:TileEngine.Camera.transformationMatrix
member.summary: Get the Matrix used to shift the position of the camera relative to the map
member.remarks: More accurately, the Matrix shifts the map to the camera location in the viewport

member.name: P:TileEngine.Camera.isFocused
member.summary: Returns whether or not the camera is focused on a particular Animated Sprite
